title: error with vim and TERM=xterm-256color: [unhandled osc_dispatch]: [['1','0',],['?',],] at line 754
body:
Which operating system does the issue occur on?

 * Archlinux
 * vim 8.1.0527-1
 * alacritty 0.2.3.1003.g3593ec7-1 (commit 3593ec72dd19f5e2766a57241f2ecb9f05929a0b)

If on linux, are you using X11 or Wayland?

X11, using i3 as the window manager

I've seen #944, but that seems to be a different error reported by the same method. I was unable to find the arguments in the error message (`[['1','0',],['?',],]`) in any other issue, so I opened a new one.

Thanks to the error log notification feature merged recently, I was made aware that every time I start vim an error occurs:
```
[2018-11-18 12:45] [WARN] [unhandled osc_dispatch]: [['1','0',],['?',],] at line 754
[2018-11-18 12:45] [WARN] [unhandled osc_dispatch]: [['1','1',],['?',],] at line 754
```

I've reproduced the error with the default alacritty config and an empty vim config. It depends on the value of `$TERM`, setting it to `xterm-256colors` produces the error, e.g.:

```
TERM=xterm-256color vim -u NONE -U NONE -N
```

When setting `TERM=alacritty`, the error does not occur:

```
TERM=alacritty vim -u NONE -U NONE -N
```

But then setting `termguicolors` make vim's output render in black and white (so no nice colors).

Other random things I noticed:
 * It does not happen with neovim (with both values for `TERM`, version 0.3.1-1)
 * It does not happen with vim 8.0 (tested only via SSH to a system running Debian stable)

Any idea what's going on here? Is there anything I can do to help?

Thanks a lot for your work on alacritty, I love it!
